articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with KCU Delegates
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with KCU Delegates
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the delegates to the celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.
					 When Kim Jong Un arrived there, all the KCU delegates broke into thunderous cheers of "hurrah!" looking up to him.
					
					 He warmly acknowledged them with a broad smile on his face.
					
					 KCU members presented him with bouquets.
					
					 He warmly congratulated the KCU delegates who are holding in high esteem as eternal sun the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who performed undying exploits for the development of the Juche-based children's movement and stoutly growing up to be juvenile patriots and masters of the youth powerhouse who would shoulder upon themselves the future of Korea. Then he had a photo session with them.
					
					 After the photo session, he, acknowledging the enthusiastic cheers of the participants, expressed the conviction that the KCU members who are pride and hope of Juche Korea would stoutly grow up to be dependable reserves for the building of a socialist power, knowledgeable, moral and healthy, while further exalting the honor of the glorious KCU of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il that has developed under their care.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Ri Il Hwan, department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Watches Performance Given by Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Performance Given by Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- "We Are the Happiest in the World", a performance of schoolchildren for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU), was given with splendor at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Tuesday.
					 Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, watched the performance together with the delegates to the celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the KCU.
					
					 The performance began with prologue "Glory to the Respected Marshal". 
					
					 The repertoire included song and dance "Generalissimo Danced with Us", chorus "General and Children" and instrumental music and song "We Are the Happiest in the World", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and Kim Jong Il Prize.
					
					 The performers showed well that the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who ushered in the bright heyday of the Juche-oriented children's movement and provided the most advantageous socialist system on this land with their noble love for the rising generations and the future are the eternal sun of the three million members of the KCU and that the Marshal who ushers in the bright future of the new generations precisely means the homeland.
					
					 The performance instilled the conviction that the future of the KCU members who are stoutly growing up to be dependable pillars of a socialist power of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Un would be bright. It ended with epilogue "Forward following footsteps of Marshal Kim Jong Un". 
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated the schoolchildren on their successful performance and warmly acknowledged the enthusiastically cheering audience.
					
					 Watching the performance together with him were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Ri Il Hwan, department director of the WPK Central Committee, Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials of the youth league.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Tours Kaysone Phomvihane Museum
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Tours Kaysone Phomvihane Museum
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the WPK, on a visit to the Lao People's Democratic Republic, visited the Kaysone Phomvihane Museum in Vientiane City on Wednesday.
					 Accompanying the delegation were the DPRK ambassador to Laos and a vice-chairman of the Committee for External Affairs of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party.
					
					 The delegation laid a floral basket before the statue of Kaysone Phomvihane before paying homage to him.
					
					 Being briefed on the career of Kaysone Phomvihane, who led the national salvation struggle of the Lao people and the struggle for building fresh Laos after founding the Republic, they looked round exhibits.
					
					 Choe made an entry in the visitor's book.
					
					 The delegation also toured the historic relic ThatLuang Tower indicative of long history and culture of Laos.

articles.title: UAWK Delegation Leaves for France
articles.content:
UAWK Delegation Leaves for France
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) led by Kil Sang Bong, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the union, left here Wednesday to take part in the Fourth Congress of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers to be held in Paris.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Chinese embassy here did friendship labor at the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm in Sunan District on Wednesday. 
					 They helped farmers who have turned out in the 200-day campaign in rice-transplanting and talked to officials of the farm.
					
					 They handed over aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Delegates of KCU Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Delegates of KCU Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The delegates to the celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) toured Pyongyang.
					 They visited the photo exhibition marking the said anniversary to look round photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They looked at the photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un for a long while.
					
					 They also visited the National Children's Science Fictions and Models Exhibition-2016.
					
					 They toured the underground exhibition hall and enjoyed skills displayed by dolphins at the Rungna Dolphinarium.
					
					 They spent pleasant time at the Rungna People's Pleasure Park, Munsu Water Park and Kaeson Youth Park.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Escalate Military Provocations against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Escalate Military Provocations against DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are getting evermore pronounced in their military provocations to aggravate the situation on the Korean peninsula.
					 The puppet military warmongers let reconnaissance drones make shuttle flights in the sky over the biggest hotspot waters along the "northern limit line" in the West Sea from 14:07 to 20:30 on Tuesday and intrude three times into the DPRK's territorial sky even 10kms for espionage.
					
					 In the meantime, a speedboat of the puppet navy and four fishing boats of south Korea infiltrated five times into the territorial waters of the DPRK deep 1.5kms from 05:30 to 16:58.
					
					 Such aerial espionage and maritime intrusion have continued every day this month.
					
					 The situation prevailing in the hotspot waters has gone beyond the danger line so that one may say the south Korean puppet forces had already started provoking a war against the DPRK.
					
					 Such military provocations beyond imagination are also observed in the area along the Military Demarcation Line (MDL), too.
					
					 The puppet military hooligans have threatened personal safety of DPRK servicepersons on a routine guard duty at the frontline area, taking posture of firing on them and breaking out in coarse invectives against them. They also intensify the anti-DPRK psychological broadcasting while inviting human scum even to the inside of the "Civilian Control Line" to scatter anti-DPRK leaflets.
					
					 Due to such reckless military provocations, the volatile areas along MDL and the hotspot waters have become a dangerous fuse for provoking a war against the DPRK in land, sea and sky.
					
					  The south Korean warmongers' military provocations in the MDL area and on the hotspot waters assume greater danger as they are a result of the scheme to drive the situation of the Korean peninsula to the phase of war.
					
					 This is well evidenced by the fact that they are getting hell-bent on military provocations everywhere in ground, sea and sky, not content with the recent gun firing at a navy ferryboat of the Korean People's Army and intrusion of 19 civilian fishing boats into the DPRK territorial waters.
					
					 It is the law of nature that the frequency of dark clouds brings rainfall. The escalated military provocation is sure to incite a merciless counteraction.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group of traitors is bound to face a stern punishment of the entire nation for such vicious scheme to cover up its heinous crimes and keep the remainder of its dirty life with reckless military provocations.
					
					Only death awaits provokers.

articles.title: Mass Rallies Held in Provinces, Cities, Counties
articles.content:
Mass Rallies Held in Provinces, Cities, Counties
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- There took place mass rallies in North Hwanghae and Ryanggang provinces, cities and counties to vow to thoroughly implement the decision made at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and become honorable victors in the 200-day campaign.
					 Present there were officials of the local party, power and economic organs, working people's organizations, industrial establishments, farms and universities, working people and youths and students.
					
					 Reports were made there to be followed by speeches of the representatives of workers, agricultural workers, youth and intellectuals.
					
					 The reporters and speakers underscored the need to bolster up independence and Juche character of national economy in every way and to wage a dynamic struggle for accomplishing the five-year strategy for the state economic development, regarding the self-development-first principle as an invincible treasured sword.
					
					 They called on all the officials, party members and working people to become honorable victors again in the 200-day campaign of loyalty by giving constant impetus to the fighting spirit which was highly displayed in the 70-day campaign.
					
					 Sunchon, Hoeryong and Songrim cities and Pukchang, Musan and Nyongbyon counties held mass rallies where reporters and speakers called on all officials, party members and workers to perform fresh heroic feats in the 200-day campaign for implementing the decision of the said congress by raising fierce flames of creating the Mallima speed campaign.
					
					 Kaesong and Huichon cities and Taehongdan, Pochon, Pakchon, Sinhung, Unryul, Samchon and Yonthan counties held mass rallies where reporters and speakers underscored the need to again perform praiseworthy miracles and feats in the 200-day campaign with the same spirit and mettle as were displayed in the 70-day campaign.
					
					 Munchon and Jongju cities and Pukchong, Myongchon, Rangrim, Ryongchon, Tongrim, Sinchon, Popdong and Changdo counties also held mass rallies where reporters and speakers ardently called for making continuous innovation, advance and attack with indomitable offensive spirit of the party, self-development-first principle and the might of science and technology and thus achieving fresh, rapid successes in the era of Mallima.

articles.title: New Kinds of Machine Tools Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kinds of Machine Tools Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Kusong Machine Tool Factory, a leading producer of machine tools in the DPRK, developed new-type CNC sphere processing lathe and CNC cylindrical grinder with its own efforts and technology.
					 According to its manager Kim Jong Chol, those advanced tools help process spherical machine parts with ease while ensuring the precision of products with a complex curved surface.
					
					 The new-type CNC machine tools can raise the productivity 2.8 times and 3.5 times as against a general processing lathe and a general cylindrical grinder respectively.
					
					 They are helpful to putting the country's machine-building industry on a higher stage.

articles.title: Tele-education System Upgraded
articles.content:
Tele-education System Upgraded
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology in the DPRK has recently upgraded the tele-education system, thus making contributions to making all the people well versed in science and technology.
					 Kim Il Nam, rector of Tele-education College under Kim Chaek University of Technology, told KCNA:
					
					 The old tele-education system provided subscribers with real-time lectures and question-and-answer circumstances in which a teacher centered.
					
					 But, the upgraded one makes subscribers freely choose any necessary objects like image of lecture, blackboard and teaching aids. In other word, it is all along for learners.
					
					 The new system is getting popular among teachers and students for its high efficiency.

articles.title: Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang International Tourist Zone
articles.content:
Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang International Tourist Zone
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang international tourist zone in the eastern central part of Korea has a rosy prospect of tourism and development for its favorable geographical conditions.
					 In the zone the weather is generally warm due to the East Sea of Korea where warm and cold currents cross each other. And there are lots of tourist resources such as historical relics, natural monuments, beaches, natural lakes and spas.
					
					 Legal and other foundations were laid for the development of this tourist zone and the promotion of tourism via land, railway, maritime and air transports.
					
					 The development of the zone began in June Juche 103 (2014) when the DPRK Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly adopted a decree on setting up this tourist zone.
					
					 A master plan for its development was worked out last year amid the interest of businessmen and investors of various countries. Under this plan, development and tourism are to be conducted simultaneously in the areas of Wonsan, Masikryong Ski Resort, Ullim Falls, Sokwang Temple, Thongchon and Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 In the Wonsan area, there are the Songdowon International Children's Camp, Songdowon Beach and Songdowon Hotel, etc. The Masikryong Ski Resort area has ten skiing courses, skating ground and Masikryong Hotel.
					
					 The Ullim Falls area extending 1,000 hectares has scenic spots like Kusul (beads) and Pidan (silk) falls and ponds. In the area of Sokwang Temple, 40 kms away western south of Wonsan City, are historical relics, mountain-climbing routes, mineral springs and treatment and tourist facilities.
					
					 Conspicuous in the Thongchon area are Chongsokjong, one of the eight scenic spots in the northeastern part of Korea, and lakes Tongjong and Sijung and sanatoria.
					
					 The area of Mt. Kumgang, consisting of Outer Kumgang, Inner Kumgang and Sea Kumgang, has natural monuments, historical relics, natural reserves, beaches and spas.
					
					 The DPRK government is striving to turn the zone into a world tourist destination.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces Reckless Remarks of Chief Executive of S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces Reckless Remarks of Chief Executive of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive is vocal about stereotyped confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north right after coming back from disgraceful tour of foreign countries for confrontation.
					 She talked nonsense at a meeting held on June 6 to mark "Memorial Day" that the north's nuclear deterrence for self-defence is "a great provocation disturbing the peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and a hurdle lying in the way of national concord and unification." She cried out for "escalating sanctions and pressure by pursuing cooperation with the international community" and for "maintaining the joint defense posture with the U.S. for strong counter-action to make the north suffer self-destruction."
					
					 A flurry of such invectives recklessly spouted by Park Geun Hye is an intensive revelation of her fear and hopelessness of a loser she feels because of a weak strategic position south Korea finds itself in face of the DPRK's bolstering of nuclear force and of her despair and uneasiness over the failure of the confrontation with the north and moves to make the north "dismantle nukes", depending on outside forces.
					
					 The chief executive of south Korea is now seized with extreme fear of the nuclear force of the north capable of foiling any sinister plot to stifle the DPRK long harbored by south Korea and its master U.S. and terminating their existence in a moment.
					
					 The nuclear force of the DPRK rapidly growing stronger despite hostile forces' harsh "sanctions" and military pressure is a reality hard to understand for Park accustomed to prolonging her days depending on outsiders. It is, indeed, a nightmare for her.
					
					 Much upset by this, she is recklessly crying out for "the north's dismantlement of nukes" like a drowning man trying to catch at a straw.
					
					 Her invectives are nothing but desperate efforts to defame the noble mission and peace-loving nature of the DPRK's nuclear force and keep afloat cooperation with outside forces for confrontation with the in the DPRK.
					
					 Even at this moment she is busy perpetrating military provocations even in the waters of the DPRK side, turning down its proposal for improving the relations. It is the height of shamelessness for Park Geun Hye to slander the nuclear force of the DPRK, talking about "peace of the world" and "national concord and unification."
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear force serves not only as a treasured sword of justice which protects peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and contributes to peace in Northeast Asia and other parts of the world but also as treasure common to the Korean nation guaranteeing national reconciliation and independent reunification.
					
					 Park is sadly mistaken if she calculates she can disable the DPRK's peace-guaranteeing weapons praised by all Koreans and other world progressives for their just nature and tremendous might through such poor mud-slinging and "sanctions".
					
					 "Counter-action" and "self-destruction" impudently touted by her in front of the nuclear-armed rival, oblivious of her poor position, are nothing but the reckless and ridiculous acts of precipitating her final doom.
					
					 Park Geun Hye would be well advised to stop such foolish and self-destructive moves to force "the north to dismantle its nukes."
					
					 She had better properly understand what is the demand of the people and what is happening in the world and behave herself, though belatedly.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Urged to Stop Reckless Provocation
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Urged to Stop Reckless Provocation
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- It is the stand of the DPRK to settle accounts with the traitors and warmongers by force as they seek a way out in confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and a war against the north, in disregard of the improvement of the inter-Korean relations and peace on the Korean peninsula, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article.
					 The south Korean warmongers are now totally denying dialogue, while misjudging the good faith and generosity shown by the DPRK for peace and security of the country and improvement of the inter-Korean relations and even they are escalating military provocations, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Therefore, the situation on the Korean peninsula is again inching close to dangerous and critical one.
					
					 The Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a statement issued as regards the prevailing grave situation solemnly declared the principled stand of the DPRK that if the south Korean authorities deny its just proposal for defusing tension and guaranteeing peace on the Korean peninsula by conducting reckless military provocation, its counteraction will be merciless physical option. 
					
					 Righteous and merciless will be the DPRK's military strike to punish the provocateurs and disturbers of peace.
					
					 We will give annihilating blows to the south Korean warmongers if they make even the slightest provocation in the areas along the Military Demarcation Line, hotspot waters in the West Sea and in any other places while challenging the efforts of the fellow countrymen in the north for the improvement of the north-south relations so that they may not harbor daydream again.
					
					 We openly declared that we are fully ready for both peaceful way and non-peaceful way of national reunification to blow up the source of evils in a moment.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers should bear in mind that the non-peaceful physical counteraction will bring the north a great victory of national reunification but the group of traitors a miserable defeat, and stop at once the reckless military provocations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye's Provocative Remarks against DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye's Provocative Remarks against DPRK's Nuclear Deterrence
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye of south Korea spat out invectives at a meeting on June 6 that the DPRK's nuclear deterrence is "a great provocation disturbing the peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and a hurdle lying in the way of national concord and unification". She blustered that south Korea would "keep escalating sanctions and pressure by pursuing cooperation with the international community". She went the lengths of raving that south Korea would "maintain the joint defence posture" with the U.S. to make someone suffer "self-destruction."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What the south Korean chief executive uttered is nothing but sheer sophism making profound confusion of right and wrong.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrence serves not only as a treasured sword of justice which protects peace and stability on the Korean peninsula from the U.S. moves to ignite a nuclear war and contributes to peace in Northeast Asia and other parts of the world but also as a treasure common to the Korean nation as it protects the destiny of the nation and ensures its prosperity.
					
					 It is thanks to the DPRK's powerful nuclear deterrence for self-defence that a war has not broken out on the peninsula despite the U.S. reckless threat of a nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. does not conceal its uneasiness and fear in face of the fact that the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear deterrence is further bolstered up both in quality and quantity.
					
					 The bombast made by Park for "stern counteraction" and "self-destruction," while kowtowing to the U.S., is no more than a ridiculous act of precipitating her final doom. Because she is unaware of her impending miserable fate in which she will have to take her last breath in face of the tremendous might of the Korean People's Army and its counter-action.
					
					 Park would be well advised to properly understand what is going on in the world and behave herself, though belatedly, rather than doing harm to south Korea and precipitating her self-ruin by insisting on her ambition to force the "north to dismantle its nukes", concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Anachronistic Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Anachronistic Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- An international TV broadcasting service of Russia conveyed the gist of comments of U.S. experts on the Korean issue contributed to the U.S. magazine National Interest as follows: 
					 The DPRK's position has become strong in the international arena in recent several months.  
					
					 The DPRK succeeded in the nuclear test in January and successfully launched a satellite in February. The Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea took place early in May for the first time since 1980. 
					
					 The U.S. government should not underestimate the DPRK's nuclear capability.
					
					 There is no way for the U.S. to stop the DPRK's nuclear program. In case a war against it breaks out, this will not be confined to the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says:
					
					 This is a noteworthy comment as it truthfully reflects the reality today when the balance of force between the DPRK and the U.S. has completely changed.
					
					 The DPRK's international prestige and influence have remarkably risen. The DPRK is demonstrating its might as a nuclear power possessed of even H-bomb.
					
					 In the past the U.S. could threaten and blackmail the DPRK, non-nuclear weapon state, with nukes. But, the DPRK, which ranks itself among nuclear powers, is putting pressure upon the U.S. through its powerful military muscle.
					
					 The situation goes to clearly prove once again that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is an anachronistic one.
					
					 The U.S. has to choose between two strategic options: To put a definite end to its hostile policy toward the DPRK or allow its mainland to suffer a nuclear disaster and to be wiped off the surface of this planet.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to properly recognize the status of the DPRK as a nuclear power and face up to the trend of the times, though belatedly, and opt to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK as early as possible.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Should Withdraw "Security Legislation" as Demanded by People: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Should Withdraw "Security Legislation" as Demanded by People: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Recently a Japanese civic organization submitted a list of 12 million signatures opposing the "security legislation" to the Diet.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 A series of laws concerning politics were adopted in Japan, but there has never been such a law as the "security legislation" which was strongly opposed at home and abroad during the Diet discussion and even at this time when it came into force after its formal adoption.
					
					 This clearly shows the dangerous and reactionary nature of the "security legislation" which passed through the Diet.
					
					 What matters is why the Japanese reactionaries are so persistently insisting on the "security legislation" despite strong opposition inside and outside Japan.
					
					 This is because the Japanese reactionaries keen on overseas expansion regard the law as a vital one for them.
					
					 In the final analysis, through the "security legislation" Japan legally provided the possibility of igniting a war of aggression anywhere in the world.
					
					 That is why the international community is becoming vocal critical of the "security legislation" and voices condemning this law are growing stronger in Japan with the passage of time.
					
					 Broad strata of Japanese people, in particular, are strongly opposed to this law, deeply concerned about the consequences to be entailed by the implementation of the scenario for overseas aggression.
					
					 Through history the Japanese people clearly learned the truth that a war would bring them disgrace and ruin only.
					
					 The Japanese reactionary ruling quarters should immediately withdraw the "security legislation", the war law, as demanded by the people, well aware that a war against other country and nation would bring them nothing but ruin.

articles.title: Rally in Paris Demands Park Geun Hye Step Down
articles.content:
Rally in Paris Demands Park Geun Hye Step Down
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A rally was held in Paris on June 3 to demand the release of the prisoners of conscience and the resignation of Park Geun Hye of south Korea against the backdrop of the international community's strong criticism of the south Korean puppet group's inhumane suppression, according to the south Korean on-line paper Saram Ilbo.
					 At the rally sponsored by the International Committee for Democratic Rights in south Korea the speakers said Kim Hye Yong, member of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy of south Korea, is on an indefinite hunger strike behind bars in protest against the authorities' unreasonable suppression.
					
					  It was an inhumane decision made without any consideration of the slightest humanitarianism that she was sentenced to prison term despite her seriously poor health, they charged.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Foreign Trips under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Foreign Trips under Fire 
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News in an article on May 27 denounced the south Korean puppet chief executive for her visits to African countries.
					 It recalled that voices censuring her African visit are growing strong in south Korea. 
					
					 Against the backdrop of worsening public opinion about her trip, Park Geun Hye voiced her opposition to the "draft amendment to the law on National Assembly" by way of giving digital signature from abroad, putting a veto over the south Korean society, it noted.
					
					 It ridiculed that this resulted in denying herself the justification for "economic recovery" for which she set about foreign tour.
					
					 There is mounting criticism because Park gave priority to "cooperation with different countries in pressurizing the north," it added. 
					
					 The floor leader of the Minju Party of south Korea, an opposition party, in a meeting of the emergency measure committee held at the "National Assembly" on May 30 deplored that it is no time for the "president" to waste time talking about the north in other countries, adding that she does not seem to strive to cope with the serious economic situation.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Discloses Base Scheme of Puppet Forces to Tide over Their Crisis
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Discloses Base Scheme of Puppet Forces to Tide over Their Crisis
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyungyang Daily News in an editorial on June 6 disclosed the base scheme of the puppet forces to tide over their crisis.
					 The editorial said a heavyweight concerned of Chongwadae held a briefing on foreign tour of the chief executive at which he referred to her "health".
					
					 This suggests Chongwadae's briefing on Park's "poor health" is aimed to rally those supporting her and calm down negative opinion, the editorial noted, adding that it is hard to trust the regime as it is going to use even health for meeting partisan interests.

articles.title: Members of S. Korean Body Launch Hunger Strike behind Bars
articles.content:
Members of S. Korean Body Launch Hunger Strike behind Bars
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Eight members of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy in south Korea launched a hunger strike behind bars on June 7 in protest against the puppet forces' human rights abuses, according to the south Korean internet paper Tongil News.
					 They recalled that Kim Hye Yong, a member of the organization, has been on a hunger strike for the last 13 days though she is seriously ill, declaring the start of an indefinite hunger strike in solidarity with her.
					
					 They noted that they were arrested while struggling against the Park Geun Hye regime but will wage an indomitable struggle even in prison to bring down the present regime and usher in a new era of independent reunification and democracy.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Korea Solidarity held a press conference around the U.S. embassy in Seoul on the same day at which it denounced the puppet forces for their human rights abuses.
					
					 The organization said that it would join the prisoners of conscience in staging hunger strike and surely win victory.

articles.title: South Koreans Determined to Fight for Independence
articles.content:
South Koreans Determined to Fight for Independence
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Broad sections of south Korean people including reunification activists, democratic figures, religionists, workers, women and students held a memorial service for Kang Hui Nam, first chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification, before the U.S. embassy in Seoul on June 5, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 The speakers recalled that Kang committed suicide on June 6, 2009 after leaving behind a written will in which he called for another June popular uprising for punishing murderer Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 Having a love for the nation and hatred for dictatorship, Kang sacrificed his life for the nation without hesitation and fought for the independence in south Korea to the last moments of his life, they said.
					
					 Democracy and reunification are not guaranteed without independence, which is the lifeblood and lifeline of south Koreans, they noted, adding that they would fight it out for independence braving the suppression.
					
					 They showed their determination to fight for the conclusion of a peace treaty, national reunification by federal formula, withdrawal of the U.S. troops and abolition of the "Security Law".

articles.title: 16th Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked Abroad
articles.content:
16th Anniversary of June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Lectures and film shows were held by the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola, the Hungarian Workers' Party and the Slovenia－Korea Friendship Association between June 1 and 3 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 At the film shows the participants watched the Korean film "Grand Celebration of 70th Founding Anniversary of Workers' Party of Korea in Presence of Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un".
					
					 The international secretary of the Youth Organization of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola in a lecture said that the Korean nation had an immortal great programme lightening the bright future for the reunification and a new era of the independent reunification opened in the Korean peninsula thanks to the publication of the joint declaration.

articles.title: British Body Discloses Crimes of S. Korean Fascist Dictators, U.S. Imperialists
articles.content:
British Body Discloses Crimes of S. Korean Fascist Dictators, U.S. Imperialists
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its website on May 24 and 25 articles disclosing the crimes committed by the south Korean fascist dictators who reduced south Korea to a theater of fascist rowdyism and tundra of human rights and democracy and by the U.S. imperialists, mastermind of the Kwangju massacre.
					 Disclosing the crimes perpetrated by the Park Chung-Hee military fascist junta that reduced south Korea to an unprecedented fascist dark society where iron rule, terror politics and tyranny stalk and tundra of democracy, the article says:
					
					 Much water flew under the bridge since an end was put to the "yusin" dictatorial rule in south Korea.
					
					 However, the south Korean people are still suffering from all misfortune owing to Park Geun Hye's merciless politically-motivated suppression and unprecedented illegal atrocities against democracy reminiscent of those in the period of the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 Park, daughter of the "yusin" dictator, changed all the fascist suppression mechanism the way as was done during the "yusin" dictatorship while eulogizing it.
					
					 The situation proves that it is necessary to bring down the dictatorial regime by the concerted efforts in order to pull outsiders out of south Korea and build a democratic new society free from fascist dictatorship.
					
					 Another article referred to many crimes perpetrated by the U.S. in south Korea.
					
					 What should not be forgotten is that the U.S. was the backstage manipulator of the Kwangju massacre, the article said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists who wire-pulled the killing of Kwangju uprisers should quit south Korea.

articles.title: KFA Praises DPRK as World for Working Class
articles.content:
KFA Praises DPRK as World for Working Class
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association (KFA) headquartered in Spain posted an article titled "World for working class" on its website One Corea Network on May 28.
					 The article said:
					
					 The heroic working class of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the DPRK are carrying on their dynamic march after fully demonstrating the spirit of victors in the 70-day campaign of loyalty towards the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It is President Kim Il Sung who put forward the popular masses, whom the exploiting class once regarded just as means helping them heap up wealth and speaking tools, as the most valuable beings in the world and masters of history.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il took warm care of the destiny of the working class in a responsible manner, true to the noble intention of the President who always put forward the working class more than anyone else out of his creed that our is the world of the working class.
					
					 The Korean people find Marshal Kim Jong Un just identical to the benevolent father who showed all loving care for the working people.
					
					 During his field guidance Kim Jong Un drops in at the hostels and dining halls of the workers to show paternal loving care for them. It is quite natural that the working people in the DPRK are moved to tears, calling him their father.
					
					 Under his great loving care, the working people sing of fruitful labor and the worksites are full of their happy laughter in the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia con delegados de ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia con delegados de ONC 
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se fotografio en el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae junto a los delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					Cuando el Mariscal llego al lugar de filmacion los delegados de la ONC le dieron grandes aclamaciones de "!Viva!" 
					
					El Mariscal respondio con amplia sonrisa agitando cordialmente la mano hacia los delegados.
					
					Y recibio los ramos de flores de los miembros de la ONC. 
					
					Felicito calurosamente a los delegados quienes se forman con firmeza como patriotas infantiles y duenos de la potencia de la juventud que se encargan del futuro de Corea enalteciendo como eterno Sol a los grandes generalisimos quienes acumularon imperecederas hazanas ante el fortalecimiento y desarrollo del movimiento infantil del Juche y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Despues de terminada la filmacion, el Mariscal respondio con la mano alzada a las aclamaciones entusiastas de los participantes. 
					
					Y expreso la conviccion de que los miembros de la ONC, orgullo y esperanza de Corea del Juche, glorificaran mas el honor de la gloriosa organizacion de ninos de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, fortalecida y desarrollada bajo la direccion de los grandes Generalisimos, y creceran con firmeza como fidedignas reservas de la construccion de la potencia socialista dotadas de ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en el acto Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del CC del PTC, Ri Il Hwan, jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Jon Yong Nam, primer secretario del CC de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion artistica por 70o aniversario de fundacion de ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Performance Given by Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- "We Are the Happiest in the World", a performance of schoolchildren for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU), was given with splendor at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Tuesday.
					 Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, watched the performance together with the delegates to the celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the KCU.
					
					 The performance began with prologue "Glory to the Respected Marshal". 
					
					 The repertoire included song and dance "Generalissimo Danced with Us", chorus "General and Children" and instrumental music and song "We Are the Happiest in the World", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and Kim Jong Il Prize.
					
					 The performers showed well that the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who ushered in the bright heyday of the Juche-oriented children's movement and provided the most advantageous socialist system on this land with their noble love for the rising generations and the future are the eternal sun of the three million members of the KCU and that the Marshal who ushers in the bright future of the new generations precisely means the homeland.
					
					 The performance instilled the conviction that the future of the KCU members who are stoutly growing up to be dependable pillars of a socialist power of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Un would be bright. It ended with epilogue "Forward following footsteps of Marshal Kim Jong Un". 
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated the schoolchildren on their successful performance and warmly acknowledged the enthusiastically cheering audience.
					
					 Watching the performance together with him were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Ri Il Hwan, department director of the WPK Central Committee, Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials of the youth league.

articles.title: Delegacion de PTC visita Museo Kaysone Phomvihane
articles.content:
Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang International Tourist Zone
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang international tourist zone in the eastern central part of Korea has a rosy prospect of tourism and development for its favorable geographical conditions.
					 In the zone the weather is generally warm due to the East Sea of Korea where warm and cold currents cross each other. And there are lots of tourist resources such as historical relics, natural monuments, beaches, natural lakes and spas.
					
					 Legal and other foundations were laid for the development of this tourist zone and the promotion of tourism via land, railway, maritime and air transports.
					
					 The development of the zone began in June Juche 103 (2014) when the DPRK Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly adopted a decree on setting up this tourist zone.
					
					 A master plan for its development was worked out last year amid the interest of businessmen and investors of various countries. Under this plan, development and tourism are to be conducted simultaneously in the areas of Wonsan, Masikryong Ski Resort, Ullim Falls, Sokwang Temple, Thongchon and Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 In the Wonsan area, there are the Songdowon International Children's Camp, Songdowon Beach and Songdowon Hotel, etc. The Masikryong Ski Resort area has ten skiing courses, skating ground and Masikryong Hotel.
					
					 The Ullim Falls area extending 1,000 hectares has scenic spots like Kusul (beads) and Pidan (silk) falls and ponds. In the area of Sokwang Temple, 40 kms away western south of Wonsan City, are historical relics, mountain-climbing routes, mineral springs and treatment and tourist facilities.
					
					 Conspicuous in the Thongchon area are Chongsokjong, one of the eight scenic spots in the northeastern part of Korea, and lakes Tongjong and Sijung and sanatoria.
					
					 The area of Mt. Kumgang, consisting of Outer Kumgang, Inner Kumgang and Sea Kumgang, has natural monuments, historical relics, natural reserves, beaches and spas.
					
					 The DPRK government is striving to turn the zone into a world tourist destination.

articles.title: Belicistas surcoreanos aumentan en forma escalonada provocacion militar
articles.content:
South Koreans Determined to Fight for Independence
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Broad sections of south Korean people including reunification activists, democratic figures, religionists, workers, women and students held a memorial service for Kang Hui Nam, first chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification, before the U.S. embassy in Seoul on June 5, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 The speakers recalled that Kang committed suicide on June 6, 2009 after leaving behind a written will in which he called for another June popular uprising for punishing murderer Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 Having a love for the nation and hatred for dictatorship, Kang sacrificed his life for the nation without hesitation and fought for the independence in south Korea to the last moments of his life, they said.
					
					 Democracy and reunification are not guaranteed without independence, which is the lifeblood and lifeline of south Koreans, they noted, adding that they would fight it out for independence braving the suppression.
					
					 They showed their determination to fight for the conclusion of a peace treaty, national reunification by federal formula, withdrawal of the U.S. troops and abolition of the "Security Law".
